name: RunInlineCSharp
description: Run C# code using .NET 10's file-based programs feature. Supports inline scripts and .cs files.
author: Jacob Bundgaard

inputs.name: scriptType
inputs.label: Script Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select whether to run inline C# code or a .cs file.

inputs.name: script
inputs.label: Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter your C# code. You can use top-level statements and #:package directives for NuGet packages.

inputs.name: scriptPath
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the .cs file to execute.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Command-line arguments passed to the C# script.

inputs.name: environmentVariables
inputs.label: Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Environment variables to set before running the script. One variable per line in NAME=value format.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for script execution. Defaults to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, the task will fail if any output is written to stderr.
